abstracts.cdata!:
This objective of the indigenous peoples
            development plan for the Natural Resources Management and
            National Parks and Biodiversity Conservation Project is to
            ensure that the PFSE and the GEF projects respect the
            dignity, rights, and culture of the indigenous people in
            Gabon and provides them equal and culturally appropriate
            benefits. This report discusses strategies for achieving
            this aim. The indigenous people of Gabon are identified as
            the Babongo, Bakoya, Baka, Barimba, Bagama, Bakouyi, and
            Akoa - the pygmies. The risks resulting from this project
            which threaten to impact thee people include: loss of
            control over traditional land, becoming even more
            marginalized in society; disintegration of the decentralized
            system of administration, less assistance received from
            government services, fewer capacities to defend their legal
            rights, dependency on other ethnic groups, loss of cultural
            and social identity. To offset these potential risks, the
            plan will establish equal legal opportunities, technical
            opportunities, financial opportunities, organizational
            opportunities, and cultural opportunities. Among the
            activities planned are putting in place capacity and
            structure, providing ID cards, recognizing the settlements
            as villages equal to other settlements, establishing
            community forests, recognizing and protecting the land use
            areas of indigenous people, announcing a national policy on
            illegal immigrants, enabling the indigenous to actively
            participate in natural resource management, improving
            intercultural communication, improving research to provide
            baseline information, ensuring indigenous people receive a
            fair share of the redistribution of forest revenue,
            facilitating forest-related decision-making,   and
            establishing a participatory monitoring and evaluation system.
